name: 'The Fast Show': Which Is Nice! Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Paul Whitehouse created 'The Fast Show' with which other comedian?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Higson.

	'The Fast Show' was first seen on British television on September 27th, 1994, and instantly became a cult hit with fans including actor Johnny Depp, who appeared in a special entitled 'The Last Fast Show Ever' in 2000.

questions.text: Simon Day played a character called John Actor. What was his nickname?
questions.explanation:
'Monkfish'.

	'Monkfish' was a detective that wasn't known for his politeness and always said it as he saw it, without regard for the poor victim.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a catchphrase by a character in the show?
questions.explanation:
'Never had it anyway'.

	Louis Balfour, played by John Thompson runs the 'grrrreat' Jazz Club. Paul Whitehouse plays Ron Manager on a Football talk show, and always mentions the grass roots of the game, like 'jumpers for goalposts'. 'Bono Estente' is mouthed by numerous actors on 'Chanel 9'.

questions.text: Which of these characters is played by Simon Day?
questions.explanation:
Dave Angel.

	Dave Angel, Eco warrior to be exact. Unlucky Alf is played by Paul Whitehouse, Colin Hunt and Swiss Toni are both played by Charlie Higson.

questions.text: Which two actors play the "suits you" tailors?
questions.explanation:
Paul Whitehouse & Mark Williams.

	Ken & Kenneth, the tailors, have provided many a laugh over the years, and their catchphrase 'Suits you, Sir' has been uttered in pubs all over Britain.

questions.text: Which character has the catchphrase 'Where's me washboard'?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Atkinson.

	Arthur Atkinson is played by Paul Whitehouse, and resembles George Formby. After every 'gag' he tells, he would always say 'where's me washboard'.

questions.text: Jesse is another character in the show. Which of these was one of his tips?
questions.correct: 'This week, I have been mostly eating raspberry poptarts'
options: 'This week, I have been mostly wearing toilet roll earrings'
'Today, I have been mostly doing nudist archery'
'Today, I have been mostly drinking chocolate lager'
questions.explanation:
'This week, I have been mostly eating raspberry poptarts'.

	Jesse is played by Mark Williams. Other tips included 'wearing a thong' and 'wearing nipple clamps'.

questions.text: Which of these comedians have appeared in the show?
questions.explanation:
Arabella Weir.

	Arabella Weir plays characters such as the un-named woman who always asks 'Does my bum look big in this?'.

questions.text: On to 'Channel 9 News'. Weathergirl Poula Fisch has only one word for the weather. What is it?
questions.explanation:
'Scorchio'.

	Poula Fisch is portrayed by 'Mrs. Merton' and 'The Royle Family' star Caroline Aherne.

questions.text: Finish the name of this character. The 13th Duke of ________.
questions.explanation:
Wybourne.

	Thanks for playing my quiz.
